snippet: A Northwestern-led study has spent almost two decades tracking more than 1,800 youths who have gone through the juvenile justice system, mostly because of gang violence.
abstract: Study led by researchers at Northwestern University spent almost two decades tracking more than 1,800 Chicago youths who have gone through juvenile criminal justice system, mostly because of gang violence; project offers portrait of both perpetrators and victims in struggling, gang-ridden neighborhoods at time when homicide rate in city has risen sharply.
lead_paragraph: A Northwestern-led study has spent almost two decades tracking more than 1,800 youths who have gone through the juvenile justice system, mostly because of gang violence.

headline.seo: Chicago Project Follows What Happens to Juveniles
headline.main: After the Violence, the Rest of Their Lives
headline.print_headline: After the Violence, the Rest of Their Lives
